intro: Hapalochilus rectilabris, commonly known as the straight-lipped spikerush, is a perennial aquatic plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater wetlands and swampy areas, often forming dense vegetation. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spike-like inflorescences. Its rhizomes help stabilize soil and prevent erosion in its habitat. Hapalochilus rectilabris plays a role in providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
